page.title: 15DOMESDAY SHOPPING SURVEY....
page.content: On Thursday 2nd. May, some children went to do a survey at the local shops - the Crescent. Most people thought that the area around the shops needed to be tidier. Most people thought that some shop-lifting went on. Some people thought that a cheap supermarket was needed because the prices were too dear. One person said the least used shop could be made into a sports shop. Most people used Gourleys or the Post Office. Gourleys is a food shop. People used other shops at the Crescent, but not as much. Most people said they would not like to live in Speke Town Lane, near the shops. Some of them said they would like seats there and someone to clean around the shops everyday. Written by Brian, Jenette, Angela and Tony of class 4S, Stocktonwood Juniors.
